definition: things are not as good as they used to be
now/the present time/current/contemporary/this (day, year etc)
(negative prefix)/not/no
as/as if/such as
former times/the past/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
surname Xi

sentences.english: The glory that was Rome is of another day.
sentences.chinese: 罗马的辉煌已今不如昔。

sentences.english: They are less connected with each other in terms of emotional contact.
sentences.chinese: 人们在情感交流方面是今不如昔。

definition: rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
to go downhill/to decline/to slump
to steadily deteriorate
things are very different now (idiom)/times have changed
uninspired/dejected/discouraged

lit. even a scrawny camel is bigger than a horse (idiom)/fig. even after suffering a loss, a rich person is still better off than ordinary people/a cultured person may come down in the world, but he is still superior to the common people
pinyin: shou4 si3 de5 luo4 tuo5 bi3 ma3 da4

definition: Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
to be getting worse with each generation

definition: lit. chrysanthemums after the Double Ninth Festival (idiom)/fig. outdated/thing of the past/dead letter
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to revere the past and neglect the present (idiom)
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to decline/to wane
the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
